Method Detail

initiate

public void initiate(boolean join,
                     String variable,
                     ExecutionContext context)
              throws CorrelationViolation,
                     SelectionFailure,
                     SubLanguageExecutionFault,
                     InvalidExpressionValue,
                     UninitializedVariable

If the correlation set is already initiated, and join is false, a CorrelationViolationException is thrown.

If join is true and the correlation set is already initiated and the correlation consistency constraint is violated, a CorrelationViolationException is thrown.

In the case in which the application of the property alias results in a response that contains anything other than exactly one information item and/or a collection of Character Information Items then a SelectionException is thrown.

Parameters:
join -
variable -
context -
Throws:
CorrelationViolation
SelectionFailure
InvalidExpressionValue
SubLanguageExecutionFault
UninitializedVariable

isInitiated

public boolean isInitiated()
Returns:
true, if the correlation set has been initiated, otherwise false.

checkConsistency

public void checkConsistency(String variable,
                             ExecutionContext context)
                      throws CorrelationViolation,
                             SubLanguageExecutionFault,
                             InvalidExpressionValue,
                             UninitializedVariable

If the correlation set has not been previously initiated, a correlationViolationException is thrown.

If the correlation set is already initiated and the correlation consistency constraint is violated, a correlationViolationException is thrown.

Parameters:
variable -
context -

getPropertyAliasQuery

private PropertyAliasQuery getPropertyAliasQuery(QName message,
                                                 QName property)
Observe that in order to retrieve correlation values from a message, a processor MUST find a matching property alias and apply it to the message. A property alias is considered matching with a message if:
  • the messageType attribute value used in property alias definition matches the QName of the WSDL message type associated with the message;
  • the message is associated with a WSDL message type where the message contains a single part defined by an element and the element attribute value used in property alias definition matches the QName of the element used to define the WSDL part.

getName

public String getName()
Returns:
the name

Returns:
